item.title: Tom Lantos and Henry J. Hyde United States Global Leadership Against HIV/AIDS, Tuberculosis, and Malaria Reauthorization Act of 2008

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote. (text: CR H7065)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.(text: CR H7065)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 231 - 185 (Roll no. 526). (consideration: CR H7069-7071, H7079; text: CR H7070)

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H.Res. 1362, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question, and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Lincoln Diaz-Balart (FL) demanded the yeas and nays, and further proceedings on ordering the previous question were postponed until later in the legislative day.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1362.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H7065-7071, H7079)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 251.

Upon the adoption of this resolution it shall be in order to take from the Speaker's table the bill H.R. 5501, with the Senate amendment thereto, and consider in the House a motion offered by the chairman of the Committee on Foreign Affairs or his designee, that the House concur in the Senate amendment. The motion shall be debatable for one hour, equally divided and controlled and the previous question shall be considered as ordered on the motion to its adoption without intervening motion.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-766, by Mr. Hastings (FL).
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-766, by Mr. Hastings (FL).

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the Senate amendment to H.R. 5501(Tom Lantos and Henry J. Hyde United States Global Leadership Against HIV/AIDS, Tuberculosis, and Malaria Reauthorization Act of 2008).

bill.title: Providing for the consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 5501) to authorize appropriations for fiscal years 2009 through 2013 to provide assistance to foreign countries to combat HIV/AIDS, tuberculosis, and malaria, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
